channels.summary: Channel shared OSINT-related academic articles, labs and programmes, plus a few discussions about research integrity, surveillance tech and US academic freedom.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute – Israel–Gaza war and the power/limits of open-source reporting
highlights.details: Article from the Reuters Institute examining how OSINT shaped coverage of the Israel–Hamas war and where open-source methods reach their limits, shared as a teaching resource for OSINT courses.

highlights.title: AI agent that evades online survey detection
highlights.details: 404 Media piece on a researcher-built AI agent that completed online scientific surveys while evading detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns that bots could poison survey-based research and the wider knowledge ecosystem.

highlights.title: Utrecht Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: Link to Utrecht University’s lab focused on open-source investigations for global justice and governance, relevant for academia–OSINT collaboration and teaching.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast – GLAN programme on global legal action
highlights.details: Shared programme from Queen’s University Belfast School of Law related to the Global Legal Action Network (GLAN), useful for those interested in legal uses of open-source evidence.

highlights.title: DOGE_Bellodi_Lee report (shared via Bluesky)
highlights.details: Cross-posted link to a report by Bellodi and Lee, circulated via John Holbein’s Bluesky post, relevant to academic discussions in the channel (likely on data or experimental methods, based on context).

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talk RSS feed
highlights.details: Reminder that audio recordings of Bellingcat Stage Talks are available via RSS and standard podcast apps, with this channel designated as the place for continued discussion.

highlights.title: Opinion and photography on death voyeurism in media
highlights.details: Two pieces on the ethics and impact of graphic death imagery in journalism: a New York Times opinion article about the ‘flood of moment-of-death videos’ and a Guardian piece on World Press Photo controversies, suggested as thought-provoking readings.

highlights.title: Terence Tao on reported suspension amid UCLA crackdown
highlights.details: A user queried rumours that Terry Tao’s research was being suspended in connection with a Trump-related UCLA crackdown and later shared Tao’s own Mathstodon post for clarification.

highlights.title: Nature article shared on academia-related topic
highlights.details: Recent Nature news article circulated as relevant background for the ongoing discussion (exact topic not elaborated in-chat).

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
Queen's University Belfast School of Law
HUD (US Department of Housing and Urban Development)

channels.summary: Regular weekly announcements covered new Stage Talks, investigations, open-source challenges, moderation changes and calls for community contributions.

highlights.title: Investigation of US federal enforcement actions in Washington, DC
highlights.details: Announcement of Bellingcat’s latest work documenting federal enforcement actions in Washington, DC after federal control, verifying 42 encounters involving federal agents and DC police, including traffic stops and detentions.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Follow-up announcement highlighting the recording of a Stage Talk on explosive ordnance recognition and current EO use in conflicts, available on podcast platforms after initial tech issues were resolved.

highlights.title: Open Source Munitions Portal Stage Talk recording
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk about the Open Source Munitions Portal, describing how to use it for tracking and analysing munitions; available as an episode of ‘Stage Talks with Bellingcat’.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenges platform
highlights.details: Repeated announcements about new OSINT challenges launched on challenge.bellingcat.com and encouragement to discuss methodology in the dedicated channel.

highlights.title: Investigation of sanctioned Crimean grain exports to Saudi Arabia
highlights.details: Summary of an investigation into Russia’s ‘shadow fleet’ shipping grain from a sanctioned Crimean port to Saudi Arabia, conducted with Lloyd’s List.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – DoubleThink Lab on information manipulation
highlights.details: Announcement for an upcoming Stage Talk with Jasper Hewitt of DoubleThink Lab on monitoring inauthentic accounts and Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference (FIMI).

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Space4Good and satellite-based social impact
highlights.details: Update on a Stage Talk with Lisa Broekhuizen from Space4Good exploring how satellite imagery and open data can support environmental and social-good investigations.

highlights.title: Dedicated, muteable forum thread for Epstein-related content
highlights.details: Moderation announcement creating a dedicated, muteable forum thread for Epstein-related discussion to reduce harm and allow users to avoid this content while keeping it contained.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment OSINT investigations
highlights.details: Bellingcat call (via Merel) for pitches on wildlife- and environment-focused investigations using open-source methods that meet international investigative journalism standards.

channels.summary: Channel briefly noted potential balloon/airship facilities in China and shared a geolocation challenge comparing two islands off Myanmar.

highlights.title: Potential airship/balloon sites in remote areas of China
highlights.details: Observation of airship/balloon-related infrastructure, including a hangar and mooring pole in a remote Chinese location, inviting further geolocation and analysis.

highlights.title: Geolocation challenge – two islands off Myanmar
highlights.details: Shared thread inviting members to compare imagery of two islands off Myanmar’s coast, encouraging collaborative analysis.

channels.summary: Discussion focused on new open-source resources for art-crime research, major heritage-trafficking cases, and practical advice for accessing specialist literature.

highlights.title: Harvard Law Nuremberg Trials digital archive
highlights.details: Announcement that Harvard Law School Library has published the first complete, fully searchable digitised collection of evidentiary documents and trial transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, valuable for WWII-era provenance and claims research.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated crackdown on cultural goods trafficking
highlights.details: Report on a coordinated operation led by Bulgarian authorities with Europol support, dismantling a criminal network involved in large-scale trafficking of cultural goods across Europe and beyond.

highlights.title: IFAR publications now free on Internet Archive
highlights.details: Announcement that the International Foundation for Art Research’s previously paywalled publications are digitised and freely accessible on Internet Archive, creating a rich data source for pre-digital attribution, provenance and dispute research.

highlights.title: US disbands cultural property investigations unit
highlights.details: Denver Post article noting that agents from Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program have been reassigned to immigration enforcement, weakening US leadership in cultural heritage investigations.

highlights.title: Accessing expensive or out-of-print art-crime books
highlights.details: Practical tip that contacting authors may yield a writer’s draft of out-of-print or overpriced books, when not contractually prohibited, helping researchers access specialised literature on a budget.

highlights.title: BBC piece shared on art-crime-related topic
highlights.details: BBC News article shared as relevant to art crime (exact case not detailed in the message).

mentions: Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program

channels.summary: Channel mixed political discussion about Israel/antisemitism with Asia-focused news, including a retired Chinese general tied to Tiananmen and a major Cambodian trafficking figure deported to China.

highlights.title: NYT article on Chinese general linked to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: Shared New York Times article about a Chinese general associated with the Tiananmen Square crackdown, relevant to historical accountability and current Chinese politics.

highlights.title: Distinguishing criticism of Israel from antisemitism
highlights.details: Conversation noting that groups like Neturei Karta and the Satmar Hasidic community are strongly critical of the State of Israel, illustrating that opposition to Israeli state policy is not inherently antisemitic.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi to China
highlights.details: Article on Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi (Vincent Chen), founder of Prince Holding Group, reportedly deported to China amid allegations of fraud and money laundering tied to human-trafficking-based ‘pig butchering’ scams and forced labour.

highlights.title: Bluesky post on Asia-Pacific topic
highlights.details: A Bluesky link from user @zeyiyang was shared for additional context on an Asia-Pacific issue (exact subject not specified in the message).

channels.summary: Members shared tools and articles for tracking aircraft and analysing incidents, including OSINT workflows with ADS-B data, NTSB updates, and a LiveATC dashboard guide.

highlights.title: CPA SkyCircles replay with KML track for resolution advisory analysis
highlights.details: Demonstration of using cpa.skycircl.es with a KML track to analyse a resolution advisory: load the linked KML, use the Closest Approaches tab, and enable position reports to understand aircraft separation dynamics.

highlights.title: Building a TweetDeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: Blog post explaining how to build a multi-column, TweetDeck-style interface to monitor LiveATC streams, useful for aviation incident monitoring and OSINT workflows.

highlights.title: Bluesky account tracking ICE aircraft with OSINT
highlights.details: Recommendation to follow a Bluesky account that tracks US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) aircraft using open-source flight data, offering ongoing investigative leads.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation on SpaceX launches and aviation safety
highlights.details: ProPublica article examining how SpaceX launches, FAA oversight and airline safety intersect in Florida and the Caribbean.

highlights.title: NTSB preliminary report – UPS Flight 2976 crash (Kentucky)
highlights.details: Link to the NTSB investigation page with a preliminary report on UPS Flight 2976’s crash in Kentucky, providing official factual information for further OSINT analysis.

highlights.title: Using AirNav Radar flight plans with ADSB-Exchange
highlights.details: Tip that an AirNav Radar subscription exposes filed flight-plan routes (blue line) even for ‘blocked’ flights; combining this with ADSB-Exchange gives origin, destination, routing and aircraft information early in the flight.

channels.summary: Only a brief thank-you message about a description update; no substantive investigative or resource-focused discussion.
Channel highlighted datasets on Central Asian military facilities and shared articles and threads on Russian troop movements, Armenia–Azerbaijan dynamics, and biolabs disinformation.

highlights.title: Oxus Society visualisation of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Link to an Oxus Society visualisation mapping military units in Tajikistan, useful for regional security and force-structure analysis.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Announcement that an interactive dataset mapping over 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan is nearly ready for release, expanding open-source coverage of regional militaries.

highlights.title: EuromaidanPress – Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article detailing Russian efforts to accelerate troop deployments in Armenia amid increasing tensions with Azerbaijan, highlighting regional security risks.

highlights.title: Biolabs disinformation narrative in Armenia
highlights.details: Commentary on a DFRLab report about how the ‘biolabs’ conspiracy narrative, previously prominent in Ukraine, is being repurposed in Armenia and now implicates organisations like the CDC and USAID and even scientific conferences.

highlights.title: Clarification on peace deal ‘initialing’ vs signing
highlights.details: Explanation, in reference to a posted tweet, that the parties only ‘initialed’ an agreement—agreeing on language and a pathway to signing—rather than fully signing and ratifying a peace deal.

highlights.title: Tweet thread from NK Observer on regional developments
highlights.details: Shared NK Observer tweet thread relevant to the Caucasus/Central Asia region (exact content not detailed in the message).

mentions: CDC (US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

channels.summary: One completed geolocation in Kherson region was documented, with thanks to new geolocators for renewing activity in the channel.

highlights.title: Geolocation – Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson (Residential, ID 2547)
highlights.details: Confirmed locations for images from Suspilne Kherson: photo 2 at 46.797151, 33.354942 and photo 4 at 46.797380, 33.354648 in Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson, with Google Maps and Telegram source links.

channels.summary: Discussion centred on Bellingcat’s own products and achievements: Stage Talk recordings, the Toolkit, new challenges, a WhatsApp channel, and an annual report.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit (one-year anniversary)
highlights.details: Reminder that the revamped Bellingcat Toolkit is a one-stop directory of open-source tools with use cases, guidance and community-written reviews maintained by volunteers.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talks podcast episodes
highlights.details: Multiple messages linked Stage Talk recordings (e.g., Arthur Brand on tracking a lost Brueghel, and episodes on far-right fashion, sketchy boats, US immigration raids, and mapping Central Asia’s armed forces) available via RSS and podcast platforms.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – mapping Central Asia’s armed forces with Oxus Society
highlights.details: Announcement that a Stage Talk featuring Michael Hilliard and Bellingcat contributors on what ‘military power’ means and how to map Central Asian forces is live as a podcast episode.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp channel
highlights.details: Launch of Bellingcat’s WhatsApp channel for those who prefer to get updates directly in their messaging app instead of other social platforms.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Publication of Bellingcat’s 2024 annual report summarising investigations, impact, and lessons learned, shared as a downloadable PDF.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenges portal
highlights.details: Direct link to the challenge portal where users can attempt OSINT puzzles, often discussed in dedicated channels.

highlights.title: Award for open-source extremist identifications
highlights.details: Celebration and link to an awards page recognising Bellingcat contributors for work on open-source extremist identifications.

highlights.title: Patreon podcast episode on the Volunteer Community
highlights.details: Announcement of an exclusive Patreon audio episode offering a behind-the-scenes look at Bellingcat’s volunteer community.

channels.summary: Channel shared a SOCOM-related job ad as a likely information-operations role and two analytical articles on why people embrace misinformation and on the ‘Biden censorship’ narrative.

highlights.title: GDIT Danish linguist job as likely SOCOM info-ops position
highlights.details: Job posting for a Danish linguist at GDIT was flagged as almost certainly a SOCOM position aimed at information operations targeting Danish media and audiences in Greenland.

highlights.title: Ars Technica – why some people value misinformation even when debunked
highlights.details: Article discussing psychological and social reasons why believing misinformation can feel like a ‘win’ for some individuals, even after it is shown to be false.

highlights.title: The UnPopulist – debunking the ‘Biden censorship’ claim
highlights.details: Piece arguing that there was never a Biden-run censorship regime, challenging a common narrative in some disinformation circles.

channels.summary: Channel welcomed a new member and shared a range of environmental OSINT resources, including climate impacts, deforestation mapping, glyphosate research, Indigenous land struggles and pollution from space industry.

highlights.title: Guardian – mosquitoes found in Iceland as climate warms
highlights.details: Article describing how mosquitoes have been documented in Iceland for the first time, linked to climate change impacts.

highlights.title: Washington Post – sinking US dams and infrastructure risks
highlights.details: Article on how many US dams are sinking and the associated environmental and safety risks; an archived copy was also provided for preservation.

highlights.title: Impact of canteen menu changes on carbon footprint
highlights.details: YouTube short reporting that simply swapping dishes in a weekly canteen menu reduced the establishment’s carbon footprint by ~30%, illustrating behavioural levers for emissions cuts.

highlights.title: Retraction of seminal glyphosate safety study
highlights.details: Post highlighting that a seminal paper long used to justify glyphosate’s safety has been retracted over concerns about authorship and misrepresentation of contributions, with a link to a Mastodon discussion.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas – deforestation mapping platform
highlights.details: Interactive map for visualising deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea and Colombia, useful for environmental OSINT work.

highlights.title: Copernicus marine Jupyter notebooks for environmental monitoring
highlights.details: Copernicus marine service tutorials providing Jupyter notebooks as e-learning material for environmental monitoring and analysis, recommended for environmental OSINT practitioners.

highlights.title: Nature article relevant to environmental topic
highlights.details: Recent Nature article on an environmental issue (exact subject not specified in the post) shared for deeper reading.

highlights.title: Grist – Miccosukee Tribe and Alligator Alcatraz land struggle
highlights.details: Article on how the Miccosukee Tribe blocked the ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ project and later faced a veto by Trump on a bill that would have returned their land, cross-posted from another channel.

highlights.title: Blue Origin wastewater and the Indian River Lagoon
highlights.details: Local news report on Blue Origin’s wastewater discharge and potential impacts on Florida’s Indian River Lagoon ecosystem.

highlights.title: Inside Climate News – China’s pressure on environmental journalism in Africa
highlights.details: Article on the suppression of environmental journalism in Africa under Chinese influence, relevant to cross-border environmental governance and press freedom.

channels.summary: Channel highlighted two significant investigations: one linking Russian ships to German infrastructure drone incidents and another showing how advertising data exposes French security personnel.

highlights.title: Digital Digging – Russian ships linked to German drone incidents
highlights.details: Investigation by journalism students using multiple open-source techniques to track Russian vessels and correlate them with drone incidents targeting critical civilian infrastructure in Germany.

highlights.title: Le Monde – ad data exposing French spies and security personnel
highlights.details: Le Monde and partners used commercial advertising data to geolocate and potentially identify French intelligence officers, police and military, illustrating surveillance risks in ad-tech ecosystems.
